context_bundle.summary: Modern Python packaging with pyproject.toml, setuptools configuration, Poetry for dependency management, building wheels, and publishing to PyPI with proper versioning and metadata

onboarding.quick_start: pip install build twine poetry && python -m build && twine check dist/* && poetry init && poetry install
common_patterns: Build package: 'python -m build' creates dist/ with wheel and sdist
Poetry project: 'poetry new myproject && cd myproject && poetry add requests && poetry install'
Version from git: 'pip install setuptools-scm && [tool.setuptools_scm]' for automatic versioning
Upload to PyPI: 'twine upload dist/* --repository testpypi' for testing, then 'twine upload dist/*' for production
known_errors: Build failed: Check pyproject.toml syntax with 'python -m build --sdist --wheel', verify all dependencies listed
Import error after install: Ensure package structure has __init__.py files, check MANIFEST.in for data files
Version conflict: Use 'pip install --upgrade package' or specify exact version 'package==1.2.3'
Poetry lock file outdated: Run 'poetry lock --no-update' to refresh without upgrading dependencies
Twine upload authentication: Set TWINE_USERNAME and TWINE_PASSWORD env vars or use API token
Wheel not universal: Add '[bdist_wheel]\nuniversal = 1' to setup.cfg for pure Python packages
